description: Latin maculatus, past participle of maculare (“to spot”).

adjectives.description: maculate (comparative more maculate, superlative most maculate)

entries.meaning: Marked with spots or maculae; blotched.

examples: [Les Misérables is] about the struggle of a mistreated man as he rises to the top, along with a mortal conflict between this maculate virtuous man and an immaculate pursuing demon.

verbs.description: maculate (third-person singular simple present maculates, present participle maculating, simple past and past participle maculated)

entries.meaning: To spot; to stain; to blur.
examples: they wolde nat maculate the honour of their people with suche a reproche
